question: Do you have a specific HEAL-funded award in mind?

answers.answer: Yes
No

question: Which HEAL Research Focus Area does the award fall under?
notes: If you aren't sure, you can find your award's focus area [here](https://heal.nih.gov/funding/awarded).

answers.answer: Clinical Research in Pain Management
Cross-Cutting Research
Enhanced Outcomes for Infants and Children Exposed to Opioids
New Strategies to Prevent and Treat Opioid Addiction
Novel Therapeutic Options for Opioid Use Disorder and Overdose
Preclinical and Translational Research in Pain Management
Training the Next Generation of Researchers in HEAL
Translation of Research to Practice for the Treatment of Opioid Addiction

question: Is the award a UG3, UH3, Small Business Programs (SBIR/STTR) award, or does it include data about American Indian/Alaska Native (AI/AN) populations?
notes: If you aren't sure of the award type, see ["Deciphering NIH Application / Grant Numbers"](https://www.era.nih.gov/files/Deciphering_NIH_Application.pdf). [Learn more about NIH's Small Business Programs](https://seed.nih.gov/small-business-funding).

answers.answer: Yes
No

question: Is the award associated with any of the following consortium awards?
notes: If no, select "None of the above".

answers.answer: Advancing Clinical Trials in Neonatal Opioid Withdrawal (ACT NOW)
Back Pain Consortium Research Program (BACPAC)
Early Phase Pain Investigation Clinical Network (EPPIC-Net)
Harm Reduction Approaches to Reduce Overdose Death (Harm Reduction)
HEAL Prevention Cooperative (HPC)
HEALing Communities (HEALing Communities)
HEALthy Brain and Child Development Study (HBCD)
Integrated Approach to Pain and Opioid Use in Hemodialysis Patients (HOPE)
Integrated Management of Chronic Pain and OUD for Whole Recovery (IMPOWR)
Justice Community of Opioid Innovation Network (JCOIN)
Pain Management Effectiveness Research Network (Pain ERN)
PRECISION
Restoring Joint Health and Function to Reduce Pain (RE-JOIN)
I don't know
None of the above

question: What type of research is it?
What is the study subject type?
answers: Human (including human cell / tissue / tissue model)
Animal (including animal cell / tissue / tissue model)
Molecule (e.g. chemical compounds, drugs, protein engineering, protein crystallization, etc)
